AnsiColor.name: AnsiColor
AnsiColor.doc: The ANSI colors.  These can be used to colorize text in the console.
AnsiColor.label: AnsiColor

AnsiColorFormatterOptions.name: AnsiColorFormatterOptions
AnsiColorFormatterOptions.doc: The various options for the ANSI color formatter.
AnsiColorFormatterOptions.label: AnsiColorFormatterOptions

AnsiColorFormatterOptions.timestamp.name: AnsiColorFormatterOptions.timestamp
AnsiColorFormatterOptions.timestamp.doc: The timestamp format.  This can be one of the following:"date-time-timezone": The date and time with the full timezone offset (e.g., "2023-11-14 22:13:20.000 +00:00")."date-time-tz": The date and time with the short timezone offset (e.g., "2023-11-14 22:13:20.000 +00")."date-time": The date and time without the timezone offset (e.g., "2023-11-14 22:13:20.000")."time-timezone": The time with the full timezone offset but without the date (e.g., "22:13:20.000 +00:00")."time-tz": The time with the short timezone offset but without the date (e.g., "22:13:20.000 +00")."time": The time without the date or timezone offset (e.g., "22:13:20.000")."date": The date without the time or timezone offset (e.g., "2023-11-14")."rfc3339": The date and time in RFC 3339 format (e.g., "2023-11-14T22:13:20.000Z").Alternatively, this can be a function that accepts a timestamp and returns a string.The default is "date-time-tz".
AnsiColorFormatterOptions.timestamp.label: AnsiColorFormatterOptions.timestamp

~AnsiColorFormatterOptions.timestamp.name: AnsiColorFormatterOptions.timestamp
~AnsiColorFormatterOptions.timestamp.doc: The timestamp format.  This can be one of the following:"date-time-timezone": The date and time with the full timezone offset (e.g., "2023-11-14 22:13:20.000 +00:00")."date-time-tz": The date and time with the short timezone offset (e.g., "2023-11-14 22:13:20.000 +00")."date-time": The date and time without the timezone offset (e.g., "2023-11-14 22:13:20.000")."time-timezone": The time with the full timezone offset but without the date (e.g., "22:13:20.000 +00:00")."time-tz": The time with the short timezone offset but without the date (e.g., "22:13:20.000 +00")."time": The time without the date or timezone offset (e.g., "22:13:20.000")."date": The date without the time or timezone offset (e.g., "2023-11-14")."rfc3339": The date and time in RFC 3339 format (e.g., "2023-11-14T22:13:20.000Z").Alternatively, this can be a function that accepts a timestamp and returns a string.The default is "date-time-tz".
~AnsiColorFormatterOptions.timestamp.label: timestamp

AnsiColorFormatterOptions.timestampStyle.name: AnsiColorFormatterOptions.timestampStyle
AnsiColorFormatterOptions.timestampStyle.doc: The ANSI style for the timestamp.  "dim" is used by default.
AnsiColorFormatterOptions.timestampStyle.label: AnsiColorFormatterOptions.timestampStyle

~AnsiColorFormatterOptions.timestampStyl.name: AnsiColorFormatterOptions.timestampStyle
~AnsiColorFormatterOptions.timestampStyl.doc: The ANSI style for the timestamp.  "dim" is used by default.
~AnsiColorFormatterOptions.timestampStyl.label: timestampStyle

AnsiColorFormatterOptions.timestampColor.name: AnsiColorFormatterOptions.timestampColor
AnsiColorFormatterOptions.timestampColor.doc: The ANSI color for the timestamp.  No color is used by default.
AnsiColorFormatterOptions.timestampColor.label: AnsiColorFormatterOptions.timestampColor

~AnsiColorFormatterOptions.timestampColo.name: AnsiColorFormatterOptions.timestampColor
~AnsiColorFormatterOptions.timestampColo.doc: The ANSI color for the timestamp.  No color is used by default.
~AnsiColorFormatterOptions.timestampColo.label: timestampColor

AnsiColorFormatterOptions.levelStyle.name: AnsiColorFormatterOptions.levelStyle
AnsiColorFormatterOptions.levelStyle.doc: The ANSI style for the log level.  "bold" is used by default.
AnsiColorFormatterOptions.levelStyle.label: AnsiColorFormatterOptions.levelStyle

~AnsiColorFormatterOptions.levelStyle.name: AnsiColorFormatterOptions.levelStyle
~AnsiColorFormatterOptions.levelStyle.doc: The ANSI style for the log level.  "bold" is used by default.
~AnsiColorFormatterOptions.levelStyle.label: levelStyle

AnsiColorFormatterOptions.levelColors.name: AnsiColorFormatterOptions.levelColors
AnsiColorFormatterOptions.levelColors.doc: The ANSI colors for the log levels.  The default colors are as follows:"debug": "blue""info": "green""warning": "yellow""error": "red""fatal": "magenta"
AnsiColorFormatterOptions.levelColors.label: AnsiColorFormatterOptions.levelColors

~AnsiColorFormatterOptions.levelColors.name: AnsiColorFormatterOptions.levelColors
~AnsiColorFormatterOptions.levelColors.doc: The ANSI colors for the log levels.  The default colors are as follows:"debug": "blue""info": "green""warning": "yellow""error": "red""fatal": "magenta"
~AnsiColorFormatterOptions.levelColors.label: levelColors

AnsiColorFormatterOptions.categoryStyle.name: AnsiColorFormatterOptions.categoryStyle
AnsiColorFormatterOptions.categoryStyle.doc: The ANSI style for the category.  "dim" is used by default.
AnsiColorFormatterOptions.categoryStyle.label: AnsiColorFormatterOptions.categoryStyle

~AnsiColorFormatterOptions.categoryStyle.name: AnsiColorFormatterOptions.categoryStyle
~AnsiColorFormatterOptions.categoryStyle.doc: The ANSI style for the category.  "dim" is used by default.
~AnsiColorFormatterOptions.categoryStyle.label: categoryStyle

AnsiColorFormatterOptions.categoryColor.name: AnsiColorFormatterOptions.categoryColor
AnsiColorFormatterOptions.categoryColor.doc: The ANSI color for the category.  No color is used by default.
AnsiColorFormatterOptions.categoryColor.label: AnsiColorFormatterOptions.categoryColor

~AnsiColorFormatterOptions.categoryColor.name: AnsiColorFormatterOptions.categoryColor
~AnsiColorFormatterOptions.categoryColor.doc: The ANSI color for the category.  No color is used by default.
~AnsiColorFormatterOptions.categoryColor.label: categoryColor

Config.sinks.name: Config.sinks
Config.sinks.doc: The sinks to use.  The keys are the sink identifiers, and the values are Sinks.
Config.sinks.label: Config.sinks

~Config.sinks.name: Config.sinks
~Config.sinks.doc: The sinks to use.  The keys are the sink identifiers, and the values are Sinks.
~Config.sinks.label: sinks

Config.filters.name: Config.filters
Config.filters.doc: The filters to use.  The keys are the filter identifiers, and the values are either Filters or LogLevels.
Config.filters.label: Config.filters

~Config.filters.name: Config.filters
~Config.filters.doc: The filters to use.  The keys are the filter identifiers, and the values are either Filters or LogLevels.
~Config.filters.label: filters

Config.contextLocalStorage.name: Config.contextLocalStorage
Config.contextLocalStorage.doc: The context-local storage to use for implicit contexts.
Config.contextLocalStorage.label: Config.contextLocalStorage

~Config.contextLocalStorage.name: Config.contextLocalStorage
~Config.contextLocalStorage.doc: The context-local storage to use for implicit contexts.
~Config.contextLocalStorage.label: contextLocalStorage

Config.reset.name: Config.reset
Config.reset.doc: Whether to reset the configuration before applying this one.
Config.reset.label: Config.reset

~Config.reset.name: Config.reset
~Config.reset.doc: Whether to reset the configuration before applying this one.
~Config.reset.label: reset

ConsoleFormatter.name: ConsoleFormatter
ConsoleFormatter.doc: A console formatter is a function that accepts a log record and returns an array of arguments to pass to console.log.
ConsoleFormatter.label: ConsoleFormatter

ConsoleSinkOptions.formatter.name: ConsoleSinkOptions.formatter
ConsoleSinkOptions.formatter.doc: The console formatter or text formatter to use. Defaults to defaultConsoleFormatter.
ConsoleSinkOptions.formatter.label: ConsoleSinkOptions.formatter

~ConsoleSinkOptions.formatter.name: ConsoleSinkOptions.formatter
~ConsoleSinkOptions.formatter.doc: The console formatter or text formatter to use. Defaults to defaultConsoleFormatter.
~ConsoleSinkOptions.formatter.label: formatter

ConsoleSinkOptions.console.name: ConsoleSinkOptions.console
ConsoleSinkOptions.console.doc: The console to log to.  Defaults to console.
ConsoleSinkOptions.console.label: ConsoleSinkOptions.console

~ConsoleSinkOptions.console.name: ConsoleSinkOptions.console
~ConsoleSinkOptions.console.doc: The console to log to.  Defaults to console.
~ConsoleSinkOptions.console.label: console

ContextLocalStorage.name: ContextLocalStorage
ContextLocalStorage.doc: A generic interface for a context-local storage.  It resembles the AsyncLocalStorage API from Node.js.
ContextLocalStorage.label: ContextLocalStorage

ContextLocalStorage.run().name: ContextLocalStorage.run
ContextLocalStorage.run().doc: Runs a callback with the given store as the context-local store.
ContextLocalStorage.run().label: ContextLocalStorage.run()

~ContextLocalStorage.run().name: ContextLocalStorage.run
~ContextLocalStorage.run().doc: Runs a callback with the given store as the context-local store.
~ContextLocalStorage.run().label: run()

ContextLocalStorage.run.name: ContextLocalStorage.run
ContextLocalStorage.run.doc: Runs a callback with the given store as the context-local store.
ContextLocalStorage.run.label: ContextLocalStorage.run

~ContextLocalStorage.run.name: ContextLocalStorage.run
~ContextLocalStorage.run.doc: Runs a callback with the given store as the context-local store.
~ContextLocalStorage.run.label: run

Filter.name: Filter
Filter.doc: A filter is a function that accepts a log record and returns true if the record should be passed to the sink.
Filter.label: Filter

FilterLike.name: FilterLike
FilterLike.doc: A filter-like value is either a Filter or a LogLevel. null is also allowed to represent a filter that rejects all records.
FilterLike.label: FilterLike

FormattedValues.name: FormattedValues
FormattedValues.doc: The formatted values for a log record.
FormattedValues.label: FormattedValues

LogLevel.name: LogLevel
LogLevel.doc: The severity level of a LogRecord.
LogLevel.label: LogLevel

LogRecord.category.name: LogRecord.category
LogRecord.category.doc: The category of the logger that produced the log record.
LogRecord.category.label: LogRecord.category

~LogRecord.category.name: LogRecord.category
~LogRecord.category.doc: The category of the logger that produced the log record.
~LogRecord.category.label: category

LogRecord.message.name: LogRecord.message
LogRecord.message.doc: The log message.  This is the result of substituting the message template with the values.  The number of elements in this array is always odd, with the message template values interleaved between the substitution values.
LogRecord.message.label: LogRecord.message

~LogRecord.message.name: LogRecord.message
~LogRecord.message.doc: The log message.  This is the result of substituting the message template with the values.  The number of elements in this array is always odd, with the message template values interleaved between the substitution values.
~LogRecord.message.label: message

LogRecord.rawMessage.name: LogRecord.rawMessage
LogRecord.rawMessage.doc: The raw log message.  This is the original message template without any further processing.  It can be either:A string without any substitutions if the log record was created with a method call syntax, e.g., "Hello, {name}!" for logger.info("Hello, {name}!", { name }).A template string array if the log record was created with a tagged template literal syntax, e.g., ["Hello, ", "!"] for ``logger.info`Hello, ${name}!```.
LogRecord.rawMessage.label: LogRecord.rawMessage

~LogRecord.rawMessage.name: LogRecord.rawMessage
~LogRecord.rawMessage.doc: The raw log message.  This is the original message template without any further processing.  It can be either:A string without any substitutions if the log record was created with a method call syntax, e.g., "Hello, {name}!" for logger.info("Hello, {name}!", { name }).A template string array if the log record was created with a tagged template literal syntax, e.g., ["Hello, ", "!"] for ``logger.info`Hello, ${name}!```.
~LogRecord.rawMessage.label: rawMessage

LogRecord.timestamp.name: LogRecord.timestamp
LogRecord.timestamp.doc: The timestamp of the log record in milliseconds since the Unix epoch.
LogRecord.timestamp.label: LogRecord.timestamp

~LogRecord.timestamp.name: LogRecord.timestamp
~LogRecord.timestamp.doc: The timestamp of the log record in milliseconds since the Unix epoch.
~LogRecord.timestamp.label: timestamp

LogRecord.properties.doc: The extra properties of the log record.
LogRecord.properties.label: LogRecord.properties

~LogRecord.properties.name: LogRecord.properties
~LogRecord.properties.doc: The extra properties of the log record.
~LogRecord.properties.label: properties

Logger.name: Logger

Logger.label: Logger

Logger.category.name: Logger.category
Logger.category.doc: The category of the logger.  It is an array of strings.
Logger.category.label: Logger.category

~Logger.category.name: Logger.category
~Logger.category.doc: The category of the logger.  It is an array of strings.
~Logger.category.label: category

Logger.parent.name: Logger.parent
Logger.parent.doc: The logger with the supercategory of the current logger.  If the current logger is the root logger, this is null.
Logger.parent.label: Logger.parent

~Logger.parent.name: Logger.parent
~Logger.parent.doc: The logger with the supercategory of the current logger.  If the current logger is the root logger, this is null.

LoggerConfig.category.name: LoggerConfig.category
LoggerConfig.category.doc: The category of the logger.  If a string, it is equivalent to an array with one element.
LoggerConfig.category.label: LoggerConfig.category

~LoggerConfig.category.name: LoggerConfig.category
~LoggerConfig.category.doc: The category of the logger.  If a string, it is equivalent to an array with one element.
~LoggerConfig.category.label: category

LoggerConfig.parentSinks.name: LoggerConfig.parentSinks
LoggerConfig.parentSinks.doc: Whether to inherit the parent's sinks.  If inherit, the parent's sinks are used along with the specified sinks.  If override, the parent's sinks are not used, and only the specified sinks are used.The default is inherit.
LoggerConfig.parentSinks.label: LoggerConfig.parentSinks

~LoggerConfig.parentSinks.name: LoggerConfig.parentSinks
~LoggerConfig.parentSinks.doc: Whether to inherit the parent's sinks.  If inherit, the parent's sinks are used along with the specified sinks.  If override, the parent's sinks are not used, and only the specified sinks are used.The default is inherit.
~LoggerConfig.parentSinks.label: parentSinks

LoggerConfig.level.name: LoggerConfig.level
LoggerConfig.level.doc: The log level to filter by.  If null, the logger will reject all records.
LoggerConfig.level.label: LoggerConfig.level

~LoggerConfig.level.name: LoggerConfig.level
~LoggerConfig.level.doc: The log level to filter by.  If null, the logger will reject all records.
~LoggerConfig.level.label: level

LoggerConfig.lowestLevel.name: LoggerConfig.lowestLevel
LoggerConfig.lowestLevel.doc: The lowest log level to accept.  If null, the logger will reject all records.
LoggerConfig.lowestLevel.label: LoggerConfig.lowestLevel

~LoggerConfig.lowestLevel.name: LoggerConfig.lowestLevel
~LoggerConfig.lowestLevel.doc: The lowest log level to accept.  If null, the logger will reject all records.
~LoggerConfig.lowestLevel.label: lowestLevel

RotatingFileSinkOptions.maxSize.name: RotatingFileSinkOptions.maxSize
RotatingFileSinkOptions.maxSize.doc: The maximum bytes of the file before it is rotated.  1 MiB by default.
RotatingFileSinkOptions.maxSize.label: RotatingFileSinkOptions.maxSize

~RotatingFileSinkOptions.maxSize.name: RotatingFileSinkOptions.maxSize
~RotatingFileSinkOptions.maxSize.doc: The maximum bytes of the file before it is rotated.  1 MiB by default.
~RotatingFileSinkOptions.maxSize.label: maxSize

RotatingFileSinkOptions.maxFiles.name: RotatingFileSinkOptions.maxFiles
RotatingFileSinkOptions.maxFiles.doc: The maximum number of files to keep.  5 by default.
RotatingFileSinkOptions.maxFiles.label: RotatingFileSinkOptions.maxFiles

~RotatingFileSinkOptions.maxFiles.name: RotatingFileSinkOptions.maxFiles
~RotatingFileSinkOptions.maxFiles.doc: The maximum number of files to keep.  5 by default.
~RotatingFileSinkOptions.maxFiles.label: maxFiles

Sink.name: Sink
Sink.doc: A sink is a function that accepts a log record and prints it somewhere. Thrown exceptions will be suppressed and then logged to the meta logger, a Logger with the category ["logtape", "meta"].  (In that case, the meta log record will not be passed to the sink to avoid infinite recursion.)
Sink.label: Sink

StreamSinkOptions.formatter.name: StreamSinkOptions.formatter
StreamSinkOptions.formatter.doc: The text formatter to use.  Defaults to defaultTextFormatter.
StreamSinkOptions.formatter.label: StreamSinkOptions.formatter

~StreamSinkOptions.formatter.name: StreamSinkOptions.formatter
~StreamSinkOptions.formatter.doc: The text formatter to use.  Defaults to defaultTextFormatter.
~StreamSinkOptions.formatter.label: formatter

StreamSinkOptions.encoder.name: StreamSinkOptions.encoder
StreamSinkOptions.encoder.doc: The text encoder to use.  Defaults to an instance of TextEncoder.
StreamSinkOptions.encoder.label: StreamSinkOptions.encoder

~StreamSinkOptions.encoder.name: StreamSinkOptions.encoder
~StreamSinkOptions.encoder.doc: The text encoder to use.  Defaults to an instance of TextEncoder.
~StreamSinkOptions.encoder.label: encoder

TextFormatter.name: TextFormatter
TextFormatter.doc: A text formatter is a function that accepts a log record and returns a string.
TextFormatter.label: TextFormatter

TextFormatterOptions.name: TextFormatterOptions
TextFormatterOptions.doc: The various options for the built-in text formatters.
TextFormatterOptions.label: TextFormatterOptions

TextFormatterOptions.timestamp.name: TextFormatterOptions.timestamp
TextFormatterOptions.timestamp.doc: The timestamp format.  This can be one of the following:"date-time-timezone": The date and time with the full timezone offset (e.g., "2023-11-14 22:13:20.000 +00:00")."date-time-tz": The date and time with the short timezone offset (e.g., "2023-11-14 22:13:20.000 +00")."date-time": The date and time without the timezone offset (e.g., "2023-11-14 22:13:20.000")."time-timezone": The time with the full timezone offset but without the date (e.g., "22:13:20.000 +00:00")."time-tz": The time with the short timezone offset but without the date (e.g., "22:13:20.000 +00")."time": The time without the date or timezone offset (e.g., "22:13:20.000")."date": The date without the time or timezone offset (e.g., "2023-11-14")."rfc3339": The date and time in RFC 3339 format (e.g., "2023-11-14T22:13:20.000Z").Alternatively, this can be a function that accepts a timestamp and returns a string.The default is "date-time-timezone".
TextFormatterOptions.timestamp.label: TextFormatterOptions.timestamp

~TextFormatterOptions.timestamp.name: TextFormatterOptions.timestamp
~TextFormatterOptions.timestamp.doc: The timestamp format.  This can be one of the following:"date-time-timezone": The date and time with the full timezone offset (e.g., "2023-11-14 22:13:20.000 +00:00")."date-time-tz": The date and time with the short timezone offset (e.g., "2023-11-14 22:13:20.000 +00")."date-time": The date and time without the timezone offset (e.g., "2023-11-14 22:13:20.000")."time-timezone": The time with the full timezone offset but without the date (e.g., "22:13:20.000 +00:00")."time-tz": The time with the short timezone offset but without the date (e.g., "22:13:20.000 +00")."time": The time without the date or timezone offset (e.g., "22:13:20.000")."date": The date without the time or timezone offset (e.g., "2023-11-14")."rfc3339": The date and time in RFC 3339 format (e.g., "2023-11-14T22:13:20.000Z").Alternatively, this can be a function that accepts a timestamp and returns a string.The default is "date-time-timezone".
~TextFormatterOptions.timestamp.label: timestamp

TextFormatterOptions.level.name: TextFormatterOptions.level
TextFormatterOptions.level.doc: The log level format.  This can be one of the following:"ABBR": The log level abbreviation in uppercase (e.g., "INF")."FULL": The full log level name in uppercase (e.g., "INFO")."L": The first letter of the log level in uppercase (e.g., "I")."abbr": The log level abbreviation in lowercase (e.g., "inf")."full": The full log level name in lowercase (e.g., "info")."l": The first letter of the log level in lowercase (e.g., "i").Alternatively, this can be a function that accepts a log level and returns a string.The default is "ABBR".
TextFormatterOptions.level.label: TextFormatterOptions.level

~TextFormatterOptions.level.name: TextFormatterOptions.level
~TextFormatterOptions.level.doc: The log level format.  This can be one of the following:"ABBR": The log level abbreviation in uppercase (e.g., "INF")."FULL": The full log level name in uppercase (e.g., "INFO")."L": The first letter of the log level in uppercase (e.g., "I")."abbr": The log level abbreviation in lowercase (e.g., "inf")."full": The full log level name in lowercase (e.g., "info")."l": The first letter of the log level in lowercase (e.g., "i").Alternatively, this can be a function that accepts a log level and returns a string.The default is "ABBR".
~TextFormatterOptions.level.label: level

TextFormatterOptions.category.name: TextFormatterOptions.category
TextFormatterOptions.category.doc: The separator between category names.  For example, if the separator is "", the category ["a", "b", "c"] will be formatted as "abc". The default separator is "".If this is a function, it will be called with the category array and should return a string, which will be used for rendering the category.
TextFormatterOptions.category.label: TextFormatterOptions.category

~TextFormatterOptions.category.name: TextFormatterOptions.category
~TextFormatterOptions.category.doc: The separator between category names.  For example, if the separator is "", the category ["a", "b", "c"] will be formatted as "abc". The default separator is "".If this is a function, it will be called with the category array and should return a string, which will be used for rendering the category.
~TextFormatterOptions.category.label: category

TextFormatterOptions.value.name: TextFormatterOptions.value
TextFormatterOptions.value.doc: The format of the embedded values.A function that renders a value to a string.  This function is used to render the values in the log record.  The default is util.inspect() in Node.js/Bun and Deno.inspect() in Deno.
TextFormatterOptions.value.label: TextFormatterOptions.value

~TextFormatterOptions.value.name: TextFormatterOptions.value
~TextFormatterOptions.value.doc: The format of the embedded values.A function that renders a value to a string.  This function is used to render the values in the log record.  The default is util.inspect() in Node.js/Bun and Deno.inspect() in Deno.
~TextFormatterOptions.value.label: value

TextFormatterOptions.format.name: TextFormatterOptions.format
TextFormatterOptions.format.doc: How those formatted parts are concatenated.A function that formats the log record.  This function is called with the formatted values and should return a string.  Note that the formatted should not include a newline character at the end.By default, this is a function that formats the log record as follows:
TextFormatterOptions.format.label: TextFormatterOptions.format

~TextFormatterOptions.format.name: TextFormatterOptions.format
~TextFormatterOptions.format.doc: How those formatted parts are concatenated.A function that formats the log record.  This function is called with the formatted values and should return a string.  Note that the formatted should not include a newline character at the end.By default, this is a function that formats the log record as follows:
~TextFormatterOptions.format.label: format

ansiColorFormatter.name: ansiColorFormatter
ansiColorFormatter.doc: A text formatter that uses ANSI colors to format log records.A preview of ansiColorFormatter.
ansiColorFormatter.label: ansiColorFormatter

configure().name: configure
configure().doc: Configure the loggers with the specified configuration.Note that if the given sinks or filters are disposable, they will be disposed when the configuration is reset, or when the process exits.
configure().label: configure()

defaultTextFormatter.name: defaultTextFormatter
defaultTextFormatter.doc: The default text formatter.  This formatter formats log records as follows:
defaultTextFormatter.label: defaultTextFormatter

getAnsiColorFormatter().name: getAnsiColorFormatter
getAnsiColorFormatter().doc: Get an ANSI color formatter with the specified options.A preview of an ANSI color formatter.
getAnsiColorFormatter().label: getAnsiColorFormatter()

getConfig().name: getConfig
getConfig().doc: Get the current configuration, if any.  Otherwise, null.
getConfig().label: getConfig()

getConsoleSink().name: getConsoleSink
getConsoleSink().doc: A console sink factory that returns a sink that logs to the console.
getConsoleSink().label: getConsoleSink()

getFileSink().name: getFileSink
getFileSink().doc: Get a file sink.Note that this function is unavailable in the browser.
getFileSink().label: getFileSink()

getLevelFilter().name: getLevelFilter
getLevelFilter().doc: Returns a filter that accepts log records with the specified level.
getLevelFilter().label: getLevelFilter()

getLogger().name: getLogger
getLogger().doc: Get a logger with the given category.
getLogger().label: getLogger()

getRotatingFileSink().name: getRotatingFileSink
getRotatingFileSink().doc: Get a rotating file sink.This sink writes log records to a file, and rotates the file when it reaches the maxSize.  The rotated files are named with the original file name followed by a dot and a number, starting from 1.  The number is incremented for each rotation, and the maximum number of files to keep is maxFiles.Note that this function is unavailable in the browser.
getRotatingFileSink().label: getRotatingFileSink()

getStreamSink().name: getStreamSink
getStreamSink().doc: A factory that returns a sink that writes to a WritableStream.Note that the stream is of Web Streams API, which is different from Node.js streams.  You can convert a Node.js stream to a Web Streams API stream using stream.Writable.toWeb() method.
getStreamSink().label: getStreamSink()

getTextFormatter().name: getTextFormatter
getTextFormatter().doc: Get a text formatter with the specified options.  Although it's flexible enough to create a custom formatter, if you want more control, you can create a custom formatter that satisfies the TextFormatter type instead.For more information on the options, see TextFormatterOptions.By default, the formatter formats log records as follows:
getTextFormatter().label: getTextFormatter()

isLogLevel().name: isLogLevel
isLogLevel().doc: Checks if a string is a valid log level.  This function can be used as as a type guard to narrow the type of a string to a LogLevel.
isLogLevel().label: isLogLevel()

parseLogLevel().name: parseLogLevel
parseLogLevel().doc: Parses a log level from a string.
parseLogLevel().label: parseLogLevel()

reset().name: reset
reset().doc: Reset the configuration.  Mostly for testing purposes.
reset().label: reset()

toFilter().name: toFilter
toFilter().doc: Converts a FilterLike value to an actual Filter.
toFilter().label: toFilter()

withContext().name: withContext
withContext().doc: Runs a callback with the given implicit context.  Every single log record in the callback will have the given context.If no contextLocalStorage is configured, this function does nothing and just returns the return value of the callback.  It also logs a warning to the ["logtape", "meta"] logger in this case.
withContext().label: withContext()

withFilter().name: withFilter
withFilter().doc: Turns a sink into a filtered sink.  The returned sink only logs records that pass the filter.
withFilter().label: withFilter()
